name: Instant Pot Sweet Potato Lentil Curry
description: Instant Pot Eggplant Sweet Potato Lentil Curry. Mung Beans, lentils, spices, sweet potato and eggplant make a filling curry or soup. Use other veggies of choice. Vegan Gluten-free Soy-free Nut-free Recipe. Make it in a saucepan or InstantPot Pressure Cooker. Easily made oil-free

video.name: Instant Pot Sweet Potato Lentil Curry /Soup. Saucepan Option | VEGAN RICHA RECIPES
video.description:
Instant Pot Eggplant Sweet Potato Lentil Curry. Saucepan Option.
FULL RECIPE HERE ➡️ https://www.veganricha.com/2017/11/instant-pot-sweet-potato-lentil-curry.html 


This 1 Pot Sweet Potato Eggplant and Lentil Curry is easy, flavorful and comes together quickly. I make variations of this often with brown or green Lentils, green Mung Beans, a combination of the two, different Veggies and spices. The combination of earthy lentils, hearty mung beans as in the video and veggies like eggplant and sweet potato makes for an amazing meal.  Use any veggies of choice. 

Serve this hearty warming bowl as a Soup or as dal with rice or grains or flatbread. Make it with various spice blends as Garam Masala or Berbere or Baharat (from Everyday Kitchen Cookbook). 

Vegan Gluten-free Soy-free Nut-free Recipe. Make it in a saucepan or InstantPot Pressure Cooker. Easily made oil-free. #vegan #video #instantpot
FULL RECIPE HERE: https://www.veganricha.com/2017/11/instant-pot-sweet-potato-lentil-curry.html

recipeIngredient: 3/4 cup lentils or a mix of (brown/green) lentils and mung beans (, soaked in warm hot water for atleast 15 mins)
1 tsp oil (, or use water to saute to make oil-free)
1/2 tsp ground cumin or ground coriander
1 cup (heaping) chopped eggplant (, or use other hearty vegetables of choice)

recipeInstructions.text: Soak the lentils if you havent already and get the ingredients ready, Switch the IP to saute. Add oil and let it get hot.
recipeInstructions.name: Soak the lentils if you havent already and get the ingredients ready, Switch the IP to saute. Add oil and let it get hot.

recipeInstructions.text: Add onion, garlic, ginger, chile and a pinch of salt. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes, stir frequently.
recipeInstructions.name: Add onion, garlic, ginger, chile and a pinch of salt. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes, stir frequently.

recipeInstructions.text: Add spices and mix in. Add tomatoes and cook for 4 to 5 minutes. Mash larger pieces.
recipeInstructions.name: Add spices and mix in. Add tomatoes and cook for 4 to 5 minutes. Mash larger pieces.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the veggies, salt, lentils and water and mix in.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the veggies, salt, lentils and water and mix in.

recipeInstructions.text: Close the lid, to sealing, and cook on manual for 11 to 12 minutes (on high pressure). Let the pressure release naturally.
recipeInstructions.name: Close the lid, to sealing, and cook on manual for 11 to 12 minutes (on high pressure). Let the pressure release naturally.

recipeInstructions.text: Fold in spinach, cayenne and lemon./lime. Let it sit for 2 mins or saute for 2 mins.. Adjust consistency if needed by adding a bit more water or non dairy milk for creamier and mix in. Taste and adjust salt, spices (add more garam masala or curry powder if needed).
recipeInstructions.name: Fold in spinach, cayenne and lemon./lime. Let it sit for 2 mins or saute for 2 mins.. Adjust consistency if needed by adding a bit more water or non dairy milk for creamier and mix in. Taste and adjust salt, spices (add more garam masala or curry powder if needed).

recipeInstructions.text: Serve with flatbread or rice/cooked grains or as a soup with crackers.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve with flatbread or rice/cooked grains or as a soup with crackers.
